sentences.sContent: We bled the car radiator off.
sentences.sCn: 我们排放汽车散热器中的气。

sentences.sContent: When her cellphone rang in class one day, the teacher smashed it against the radiator.
sentences.sContent_eng: When her cellphone rang in class one day, the teacher smashed it against the radiator.
sentences.sCn: 有一次在课堂上她的手机响了，老师立马将它摔到了暖气片上。

sentences.sContent: It still has dingy corridors, ancient washrooms, rusting bunk beds (six to a room), a single fluorescent bulb hanging from the ceiling and an ancient radiator in front of the window.
sentences.sContent_eng: It still has dingy corridors, ancient washrooms, rusting bunk beds (six to a room), a single fluorescent bulb hanging from the ceiling and an ancient radiator in front of the window.
sentences.sCn: 仍旧是昏暗的走廊，老式的厕所，生锈的床铺（六人一间），一只荧光灯泡吊在天花板上，还有一只旧暖气片放在窗前。

synos.tran: [电]散热器；[建]暖气片；[声][物][核]辐射体

phrases.pCn: n. 散热器；热辐射器；散热片
催化燃烧；铸铁制散热器

words.tran: 辐射的；容光焕发的；光芒四射的
辐射；光辉；发光；容光焕发
辐射；流露；发光；从中心向各方伸展
辐射；传播；流露；发射；广播

trans.tranOther: a thin metal container that is fastened to a wall and through which hot water passes to provide heat for a room
